paper_abstract: We consider the -strong conflict-free (-SCF) coloring of a set of points on a line with respect to a family of intervals: Each point on the line must be assigned a color so that the coloring is conflict-free in the following sense: in every interval of the family there are at least colors each appearing exactly once in . We first present a polynomial-time approximation algorithm for the general problem; the algorithm has approximation ratio 2 when and when . In the special case of a family that contains all possible intervals on the given set of points, we show that a 2-approximation algorithm exists, for any . We also provide, in case , a quasipolynomial time algorithm to decide the existence of a -SCF coloring that uses at most colors.
